nodes.text: The F-143, also known as a Coruscant fire suppression ship, emergency firespeeder, emergency fire suppression speeder, firespeeder, or fireship (also phrased fire ship), was a model of speeder utilized for fire suppression.

The F-143 emergency firespeeder was a fire suppression ship manufactured by Rothana Heavy Engineering. Designed to provide essential disaster relief, these speeders carried several fire-retardant agents including tanks of water and foam on the ship's undercarriage. These fire-fighting solutions were released through pressurized dousers mounted to the vehicle's four wingtips.

A tractor beam projector was fitted below the heat-resistant cockpit to shift debris during emergencies. The interior was equipped with a medical bay where crewmembers could treat serious injuries quickly, and the exterior featured flashing emergency lights.
The ship was equipped with water spray, foam spray, fire retardant and agents.
The Galactic Republic made use of fireships during the Clone Wars, crewed by members of the Coruscant Rescue Ops equipped with radiation-proof suits and handheld fire suppression hoses.

Several fireships were mobilized in an attempt to put out the flaming wreck of the Invisible Hand as it crash-landed on Coruscant, at the conclusion of the Battle of Coruscant. Fire crews followed the wreck down to an airstrip landing, dousing flames on the hull with their dousers.

The Royal House of Naboo also maintained fire teams, who were mobilized during the Imperial Operation: Cinder following the Battle of Endor. The teams' dousers were brought to bear on the fires caused by typhoon-strength storms.
The emergency fire suppression speeder was conceived on February 7, 2003 by George Lucas for his 2005 film Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith.
